column4: I want to synchronize a folder on my windows machine with a the htdocs folder of apache on my ubuntu machine.  What's the best way to go about this?
It has to update the apache folder everytime I save anything.
try dokan sshfs to mount your apache folder on your windows machine
that means the actual files would reside on the apache machine's hdd?
yes
yeah, that's a problem.  I need the files to live on my windows machine.
Is there no way to do it the other way round?
Somehow synch with ftp?
hit google for dirsync win32
k, thanks.
you sure this application is kosher?  The English is pretty borken.
well it seems to be made by some germans, that would explain the english, I used it quite some time, but I can not guarantee for anything of course
k, fair enough.
this program stops working after the trial period?
not sure as I switched to dokan quite soon
is Dokan going to be a viable option for me (I don't know what it does).
just to make sure http://www.dirsyncpro.org/ this is what we are talking about?
Oh, I was talking about this: http://www.archersoft.com/
well probably not as the files will reside on the apache machine. you could still use dokan and sync your "local dokan" drive with your dev folder(s)
Is there no way to have a shared directory on a windows machine be the mounted on an Ubuntu machine, and then set httpd.conf to use that mounted directory as it's base directory?
you could mount it from the ubuntu machine: mount -t cifs -o user=foo,pass=bar,domain=qouz,rw,noexec,noatime //windowze/share /mnt/here and set up apache to have its files in /mnt/here
apache would be cool with that?
depends, you must make shure, apache will have access rights to /mnt/here and unix is picky about lower/uppercase while windows is not
cool.  Thanks for the help.
